creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
When I try to use my existing build file from 1.4 under either 1.5 beta 1 or 
1.5 beta 2, I see


ejbjar:
Unable to load dependency analyzer: 
org.apache.tools.ant.util.depend.bcel.AncestorAnalyzer
building account.jar with 6 files
building accountmanager.jar with 13 files
C:\depot\main\ejbcgen\COM\soundbite\ejb\accountmanager\PlanWriterPSWebLogic_CMP_
RDBMS.java:11: cannot resolve symbol
symbol  : class PSRdbms_Base  
location: package rdbms
public class PlanWriterPSWebLogic_CMP_RDBMS extends 
weblogic.cmp.rdbms.PSRdbms_Base

creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
Created attachment 1990
build snippet invoking ejbjar task

creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
I have installed BCEL, and no longer get that warning, but I still see the same 
errors when attempting to compile CMP EJBs.

creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
Created attachment 1993
ant -debug output for a CMP EJB

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
Can you do me a favour? Please run things with the default logger. It gives me
more info about where things are happening. Thanks.

I've fixed this. Apparently when you provide a classpath via -classpath to
weblogic.ejbc it can no longer find the persistence jar. The -classpath is now
only used if you specify a weblogic classpath.

Also please refer to 
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=5094

As a workaround in the current beta add the RDBMS jar into the classpath.
creator: conor@apache.org

text: Applied the patch it got it working.  Thanks.
creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
